page.title: 09HOME LIFE
page.content: The quality of life depends on use of a car, public transport is inadequate. Nearest shops, doctor, dentist, hospital are in Buckingham. Most young families have 2 cars, own their own home and use the village as a "resting place", while the elderly and poor vegitate. Much use is made of conven- ience foods full of chemicals, while skimmed milk, wholemeal bread, less sugar and salt show the trend towards healthier living - coupled with regular exercise. Among villagers there is a caring attitude for one another, but little community spirit. This may be due to lack of a shop which is a great meeting place, or absence of modern village hall - one one used now is hardly more than a shed.
